00006 #include <stdio.h>

00009 // dead simple encoding.
00010 
00011 int hexes(char c) {
00012   int result = -1;
00013   switch (c) {
00014     case '0': result = 0; break;
00015     case '1': result = 1; break;
00016     case '2': result = 2; break;
00017     case '3': result = 3; break;
00018     case '4': result = 4; break;
00019     case '5': result = 5; break;
00020     case '6': result = 6; break;
00021     case '7': result = 7; break;
00022     case '8': result = 8; break;
00023     case '9': result = 9; break;
00024     case 'a': result = 10; break;
00025     case 'b': result = 11; break;
00026     case 'c': result = 12; break;
00027     case 'd': result = 13; break;
00028     case 'e': result = 14; break;
00029     case 'f': result = 15; break;
00030   }
00031   return result;
00032 }
00033 
00034 int hexof(char a, char b) {
00035   // take a, b | a and b are strings [0..9] + [a..f]
00036   // a == 16^1, b == 16^0
00037   int vala = 16 * hexes(a);
00038   int valb = hexes(b);
00039   if (vala < 0 || valb < 0) {
00040     printf("hexdecode got some bad data\n");
00041     return -1;
00042   }
00043   return vala+valb;
00044 }
00045 
00046 std::string hexdecode(std::string src) {
00047   int src_len = src.size();
00048   std::string out;
00049 
00050   for (int i = 0; i < src_len/2; i++) {
00051     char a = src[i*2];
00052     char b = src[i*2+1];
00053     char cur = hexof(a, b);
00054     out += cur;
00055   }
00056   return out;
00057 }
00058 
00059 #endif
